page.title: 12BUCTON QUARRY
page.content: Bucton Quarry has been carved out of the top of Bucton Hill overlooking the Tame Valley. The scar on the landscape can be seen for miles around and has been the subject of much local concern by environmentalists. Stone from the quarry was used originally for dry stone walling to mark the boundaries of estates and to enclose pastures. After falling into disuse it was re-opened to provide hardcore for a new runway extension at Manchester International Airport. The hill is the site of an ancient monument, Bucton Castle an early British settlement. Local inhabitants in and around Carrbrook village have expressed great concern over the large numbers of heavy vehicles which reduce the quality of life in this quiet corner of Tameside.
